fields.description:
Two main things we could update here:
 # The general description of what the decimal type is and is for and/or a link to the C++ docs - in the details section, add some explanation of what an Arrow {{decimal()}} type is and why it is automatically mapped to an R {{double}} type
 # Documentation of the params precision and scale.  We could add a bit more information to explain what that actually means to the user, as it's not immediately obvious.

comments.body: We implement the R {{decimal()}} as a binding to {{{}Decimal128Type{}}}. This means that the maximum precision it can deal with is 38 significant digits. I think we should implement a check on precision <= 38 and offer an informative message.

I think [ARROW-4621|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4621] might already be solved by [these tests|https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/14fa2cbb837bdfc5131b944df155804098299a91/r/tests/testthat/test-data-type.R#L387-L398]. Or do we need to expand them?

That's just the type. I believe there still aren't tests for working with Decimal arrays. Though the example on ARROW-11631 suggests that you could write tests by creating floats and casting to decimal, so that's something.

Should we extend the ticket to deprecate {{decimal()}} and implement {{decimal128()}} and {{decimal256()}} as per Antoine's suggestion:

"For the record, it would be good to deprecate the decimal call and replace it with decimal128 (also, is decimal256 exposed?)."

Any thoughts? [~thisisnic][~npr][~jonkeane][~paleolimbot]
Probably so, IIUC that would be more consistent with the C++ library and others.

I think I will address the issue _as-is_ in this ticket and then open follow-up tickets to implement {{decimal128()}} a direct replacement for {{decimal()}} and {{decimal256()}} - which is a bit more involved.
